creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: man with long sword, kneeling, shaking the hand of another man with beard at L; another male figure at far L watches, holding hand to face; estate with trees in background
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

-- numbered in plate at upper right: 1
-- inscribed at top of print: [PATER DA MIHI PORCIONEM SVBSTANCIAE, QVAE AD ME REDIT]
-- in graphite on verso: a45719 | 978-81 | B.39 II | I Etat / ex | 49 (above stamp)
markings: brown stamp on verso, LR: Adalbert von Lanna, Lugt 2773
portfolio: From Story of the Prodigal Son, Plate 1
provenance: Joseph-Guillaume-Jean Camberlyn (1783-1861), The Hague and Brussels (sales 1865-67). Adalbert von Lanna (1836-1909), Lugt 2773, Prague (sales 1909-11). [Kennedy Galleries, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Departure of the Prodigal Son, From Story of the Prodigal Son, Plate 1
